Select what language BattStatt should be displayed in.

BattStatt does not act as an application but as a widget.

You can access BattStatt by either doing a long press on your home screen, selecting Widget and add the BattStatt widget of your choice, or on your home screen press the Menu button > Add and then selecting Widget and selecting the BattStatt widget of your choice.

Please note that the Motorola Droid/Milestone apparently only reports its battery percentage in 10 intervals, so you might experience that BattStatt isn't as precise as you wish.

This version of BattStatt is rather limited to what you can configure. In the Pro version, however, can can configure the following:

Custom fonts!
Choose from the standard Android fonts or add you own on the sdcard and then use them in the widgets.

Text options:
- Choose which words that should be in capital letters or which words that should be in bold.
- Set the fontsizes for each of the different words.

Colors:
Select freely which colors you want, and which words that should have them. You can also set the background color freely and its transparency.

And more...
